importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the most recent development in the 2025 MLB postseason.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The timeframe during which the article was published and updated, reflecting the live status of the 2025 MLB postseason developments.

keyTakeAways: The Los Angeles Dodgers have a 3-0 lead over the Milwaukee Brewers in the NLCS and are one win away from a second consecutive World Series appearance.
The Dodgers are the first defending champion to reach the World Series in 16 years, with the last such team being the 2009 Philadelphia Phillies.
The Boston Red Sox are the only team to win a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games; teams with a 3-0 lead have won 40 times in MLB history.
The Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners in the ALCS after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, making the series 2-2.
Max Scherzer, 41 years old, played a pivotal role in the Blue Jays' victory with a strong performance (2 runs, 3 hits in 5 2/3 innings), and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his fifth playoff home run.
The Dodgers have a 8-1 postseason record, with their only loss being against the Philadelphia Phillies in the NLDS.
The Blue Jays have won each of the first four games as the road team in the ALCS, with Game 5 scheduled in Seattle.
The Dodgers and Blue Jays are both on the verge of World Series appearances, marking a pivotal moment in the 2025 MLB postseason.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Major League Baseball (MLB) team based in Los Angeles, competing in the National League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Dodgers are in a strong position to reach the World Series for the second consecutive year, making them a central figure in the 2025 postseason narrative.

namedEntities.name: Milwaukee Brewers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team based in Milwaukee, competing in the National League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Brewers are the current opponents in the NLCS, and the Dodgers' 3-0 lead puts them on the brink of a World Series berth.

namedEntities.name: Philadelphia Phillies
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team based in Philadelphia, competing in the National League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Phillies were the last team to achieve a back-to-back World Series appearance in 2009, providing historical context for the Dodgers' current situation.

namedEntities.name: Boston Red Sox
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team based in Boston, competing in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Red Sox are the only team to win a best-of-seven series after losing the first three games, which is a statistical benchmark mentioned in the article.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team based in Seattle, competing in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Mariners are the current opponents of the Blue Jays in the ALCS, and the series is tied after Game 4.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB team based in Toronto, competing in the American League.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Blue Jays have tied the Mariners in the ALCS, creating a pivotal moment in the postseason and opening the door to a World Series appearance.

namedEntities.name: Max Scherzer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A 41-year-old MLB pitcher who has played 18 seasons in the league.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Scherzer played a key role in the Blue Jays' playoff win, contributing to their momentum in the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An MLB player who hit his fifth playoff home run in the current postseason.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Guerrero Jr. contributed significantly to the Blue Jays' offensive surge in Games 3 and 4 of the ALCS.

namedEntities.name: Jacob Misiorowski
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Milwaukee Brewers pitcher and rookie in the postseason.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Misiorowski struck out nine batters, setting a Milwaukee rookie postseason record, and helped keep the game close in the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Abner Uribe
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Dodgers player whose throwing error led to a run in Game 4 of the NLCS.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Uribe’s error enabled Freddie Freeman to score, helping the Dodgers take a 3-1 lead.

namedEntities.name: Freddie Freeman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Dodgers player who scored on a throwing error and contributed offensively.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Freeman scored a run in the sixth inning, helping the Dodgers extend their lead in the NLCS.

namedEntities.name: Tommy Edman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Dodgers player who hit an RBI single and expressed excitement about the team’s momentum.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Edman’s RBI single started the Dodgers’ lead in the sixth inning and expressed the team’s current confidence and momentum.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Los Angeles Dodgers are on the verge of securing their second consecutive World Series appearance after a 3-1 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers in the National League Championship Series, with a 3-0 lead and only one game remaining. Historically, the Dodgers become the first defending champion to reach the World Series in 16 years, following the 2009 Phillies. Meanwhile, in the American League Championship Series, the Toronto Blue Jays have tied the Seattle Mariners 2-2 after outscoring them 21-6 in Games 3 and 4, with Max Scherzer and Vladimir Guerrero Jr. playing key roles. This pivotal moment in MLB postseason history highlights both teams’ momentum and potential matchups in the 2025 World Series.
title: Dodgers close in on second straight World Series appearance, Blue Jays knot up ALCS against Mariners
